<span><strong style="color:#000">Markets:</strong></span><span> To close out one of the most unpredictable stock market weeks in recent memory, the stock indexes </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/27/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-new.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged higher</a></span><span>—and the Dow had its best day of 2022. Just how volatile was the market this week? The S&P swung at least 2.25% every single day…and ended up on Friday afternoon around where it started Monday morning.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>US employers are paying up for their workers. New data showed that overall compensation climbed 4% annually last quarter, the biggest jump in two decades. That’s still not enough to keep up with inflation, which is climbing at its </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-consumer-spending-prices-inflation-803bac5da091d3b7ad1b19a1dc36991a?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fastest pace</a></span><span> since 1983.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INFRASTRUCTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/pittsburgh-bridge-collapses-before-biden-infrastructure-visit?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Pittsburgh bridge crashes Biden’s infrastructure party
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/pittsburgh-bridge-collapses-before-biden-infrastructure-visit?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="US President Joe Biden and the Mayor of Pittsburgh Ed Gainey visit the scene of the Forbes Avenue Bridge collapse over Fern Hollow Creek in Frick Park in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, January 28, 2022." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fba79e7ed8ddbbd0e9b4acaf3ce90f4e13217fa4-3840x2560.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Saul Loeb/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At 6:39am on Friday morning, the heavily trafficked Fern Hollow Bridge located in Pittsburgh’s East End <a href="https://www.publicsource.org/bridge-collapse-pittsburgh-allegheny-infrastructure-biden/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collapsed</a> with five cars and a bus on it, injuring 10 people. And because irony is real, President Biden was scheduled to arrive in Pittsburgh only hours after the splinter to promote, what else, the $1.2 trillion infrastructure package that he recently signed into law.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details:</strong> The Fern Hollow Bridge was built in 1970 and had received a “poor” rating in regular inspections from 2011–17, according to the National Bridge Inventory.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>29 bridges in Pittsburgh are considered to be in poor condition and at least 53 have a poorly rated component.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Kent Harries, a University of Pittsburgh engineering professor, </span><span><a href="https://www.publicsource.org/bridge-collapse-pittsburgh-allegheny-infrastructure-biden/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Public Source</a></span><span> that just because a bridge gets a poor rating doesn’t mean it’s necessarily on the verge of collapse. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Fern Hollow Bridge, for its part, was most recently inspected last September. The details of that inspection haven’t been released and the cause of the collapse is still being investigated (the bridge’s 2019 report mentioned problems with the deck and superstructure).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pittsburgh’s 2022 budget contains only $7.25 million for bridge updates, and repairs are made on a “worst come, first served” basis. Two researchers estimated it would cost roughly $458 million to address every single bridge issue in the city famous for its bridges.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Biden told Air Force One, “Yinz gotta make a pit stop”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The president reshuffled his Pittsburgh itinerary to visit the site of the bridge collapse and speak with first responders and officials. He also used the occasion to tout the funds the infrastructure package would bring to cities like Pittsburgh for bridge upkeep and repairs.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Under the law, more than $27 billion will be spent over the next five years fixing the 45,000+ bridges around the country that are currently rated in poor condition.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The idea that we’ve been so far behind on infrastructure for so many years, it’s mind boggling,” Biden said.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Administration officials said this program isn’t just for bridges about to bust—it will also hopefully encourage local governments to take on more lower-priority projects sooner.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/28/warren-buffett-winning-streak-apple-bet?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
This guy won the week
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/28/warren-buffett-winning-streak-apple-bet?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Warren Buffett " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0d3cb4ac0d42ad1828d0043d0f7f6f17463f52f0-3106x2160.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>J. Kempin/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Warren Buffett once wrote, “Someone’s sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That quote has become eerily autobiographical. Yesterday Buffett’s company, Berkshire Hathaway, made <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/28/buffetts-berkshire-hathaway-gains-8-billion-in-one-day-on-apple.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly $10 billion</a> on its investment in Apple alone, whose stock it began buying in 2016. Apple shares jumped nearly 7% after it managed to sidestep the supply chain bottlenecks that have dogged competitors and report record quarterly revenue.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Not typically known for his bets on the tech industry, Buffett has remained bullish on the iPhone maker, amassing a 5.4% stake and calling Apple “probably the best business I know in the world.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As Apple’s share price has skyrocketed over the years, Berkshire has returned </span><span><a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warren-buffett-apple-stock-record-400-percent-gain-berkshire-hathaway-2022-1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 5x</a></span><span> its investment on Apple, as of earlier this month.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Buffett also showed this week that his commitment to companies in unsexy sectors can be prudent when markets get turbulent. Since the start of 2020, Berkshire Hathaway has <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-cathie-wood-ark-innovation-tech-stocks-2022-1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outperformed</a> Cathie Wood’s Ark Innovation ETF, a fund comprised of disruptive tech companies that’s collapsed over the past few months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>after two years of going virtual due to the pandemic, Berkshire Hathaway’s annual shareholder meeting, aka “Woodstock for Capitalists,” will be held <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/warren-buffetts-berkshire-hathaway-will-host-annual-meeting-in-person-11643138863?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in person</a> on April 30. Book your flights to Omaha now.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/waymo-sues-california-dmv-keep-crash-info-secret?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Waymo’s got a secret. Can the DMV keep it?
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/waymo-sues-california-dmv-keep-crash-info-secret?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Waymo vehicle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f42a921f45dacfac470f4e28337425b3638fc834-800x533.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Waymo</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Autonomous car company Waymo is <a href="https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2022-01-28/waymo-robot-taxi-sues-state-secret-black-ice?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suing</a> the California Department of Motor Vehicles over a request to share its fleet’s crash info with the public.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Alphabet subsidiary is also demanding that the DMV keep under wraps how it responds when its vehicles—which have just-in-case drivers—experience emergencies, veer off course, and navigate steep hills and tight curves (aka all of San Francisco, where Waymos are almost as common as soup dumplings).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Waymo’s reasoning?</strong> These are “trade secrets” that would give its competitors, like GM’s Cruise, a leg up and releasing the intel would have a “chilling effect” on the entire industry because no one wants their proprietary tech put on blast.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Others, including the DMV, argue that the public should know more about their autonomous neighbors, especially since Waymo’s developed a bit of a track record: With 24 crashes, it accounted for <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/self-driving-car-accidents-waymo-cruise-tesla-zoox-san-francisco-2022-1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the most</a> autonomous-mode crashes in CA last year out of its peers (though no serious injuries or fatalities), Insider reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>expect more regulatory tussles as autonomous vehicles slowly but surely make their way onto city streets. Waymo tripled the size of its CA fleet last year and started testing vehicles in New York and New Jersey.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/28/key-performance-indicators-january-29?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">

Key performance indicators

<img alt="A chart showing Americans happiness levels over the decades " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a4380b158f5ef3461b36c1d9ca41595da9d5cca5-2047x1451.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>The Why Axis. Used with permission.</em></small></span>

<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Americans are <a href="https://thewhyaxis.substack.com/p/new-data-shows-americans-more-miserable?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not OK</a> during the pandemic. According to the General Social Survey, the share of people who said they were “very happy” plunged from 31% in 2018 to 19% in 2021, while the share of people who were “not too happy” surged from 13% to 24%. Over the past few decades, the very happy people had outnumbered the not-too-happies by about three to-one.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Over the past two years, we prioritized certain strategic projects that distracted us from the laser-focus we needed to have on our core business: scaling our beauty brand.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Emily Weiss, founder and CEO of Glossier, told employees in a Wednesday email that the online beauty startup would be laying off over one-third of its corporate staff (about 80 employees). The brand that brought us “looking wet” as a makeup trend has grown to a valuation of more than $1 billion, but, “We also got ahead of ourselves on hiring,” Weiss wrote. “These missteps are on me.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Seven technologies to watch in 2022. (<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-022-00163-x?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nature</a>)</p>
</div>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nINFRASTRUCTURE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/pittsburgh-bridge-collapses-before-biden-infrastructure-visit?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPittsburgh bridge crashes Biden’s infrastructure party\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/pittsburgh-bridge-collapses-before-biden-infrastructure-visit?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"US President Joe Biden and the Mayor of Pittsburgh Ed Gainey visit the scene of the Forbes Avenue Bridge collapse over Fern Hollow Creek in Frick Park in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, January 28, 2022.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fba79e7ed8ddbbd0e9b4acaf3ce90f4e13217fa4-3840x2560.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSaul Loeb/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt 6:39am on Friday morning, the heavily trafficked Fern Hollow Bridge located in Pittsburgh’s East End \u003ca href=\"https://www.publicsource.org/bridge-collapse-pittsburgh-allegheny-infrastructure-biden/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollapsed\u003c/a\u003e with five cars and a bus on it, injuring 10 people. And because irony is real, President Biden was scheduled to arrive in Pittsburgh only hours after the splinter to promote, what else, the $1.2 trillion infrastructure package that he recently signed into law.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details:\u003c/strong\u003e The Fern Hollow Bridge was built in 1970 and had received a “poor” rating in regular inspections from 2011–17, according to the National Bridge Inventory.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e29 bridges in Pittsburgh are considered to be in poor condition and at least 53 have a poorly rated component.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eKent Harries, a University of Pittsburgh engineering professor, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.publicsource.org/bridge-collapse-pittsburgh-allegheny-infrastructure-biden/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Public Source\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that just because a bridge gets a poor rating doesn’t mean it’s necessarily on the verge of collapse. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Fern Hollow Bridge, for its part, was most recently inspected last September. The details of that inspection haven’t been released and the cause of the collapse is still being investigated (the bridge’s 2019 report mentioned problems with the deck and superstructure).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePittsburgh’s 2022 budget contains only $7.25 million for bridge updates, and repairs are made on a “worst come, first served” basis. Two researchers estimated it would cost roughly $458 million to address every single bridge issue in the city famous for its bridges.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBiden told Air Force One, “Yinz gotta make a pit stop”\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe president reshuffled his Pittsburgh itinerary to visit the site of the bridge collapse and speak with first responders and officials. He also used the occasion to tout the funds the infrastructure package would bring to cities like Pittsburgh for bridge upkeep and repairs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnder the law, more than $27 billion will be spent over the next five years fixing the 45,000+ bridges around the country that are currently rated in poor condition.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The idea that we’ve been so far behind on infrastructure for so many years, it’s mind boggling,” Biden said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdministration officials said this program isn’t just for bridges about to bust—it will also hopefully encourage local governments to take on more lower-priority projects sooner.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Kempin/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWarren Buffett once wrote, “Someone’s sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat quote has become eerily autobiographical. Yesterday Buffett’s company, Berkshire Hathaway, made \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/28/buffetts-berkshire-hathaway-gains-8-billion-in-one-day-on-apple.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly $10 billion\u003c/a\u003e on its investment in Apple alone, whose stock it began buying in 2016. Apple shares jumped nearly 7% after it managed to sidestep the supply chain bottlenecks that have dogged competitors and report record quarterly revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNot typically known for his bets on the tech industry, Buffett has remained bullish on the iPhone maker, amassing a 5.4% stake and calling Apple “probably the best business I know in the world.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs Apple’s share price has skyrocketed over the years, Berkshire has returned \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warren-buffett-apple-stock-record-400-percent-gain-berkshire-hathaway-2022-1?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly 5x\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its investment on Apple, as of earlier this month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBuffett also showed this week that his commitment to companies in unsexy sectors can be prudent when markets get turbulent. Since the start of 2020, Berkshire Hathaway has \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-cathie-wood-ark-innovation-tech-stocks-2022-1?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutperformed\u003c/a\u003e Cathie Wood’s Ark Innovation ETF, a fund comprised of disruptive tech companies that’s collapsed over the past few months.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eafter two years of going virtual due to the pandemic, Berkshire Hathaway’s annual shareholder meeting, aka “Woodstock for Capitalists,” will be held \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/warren-buffetts-berkshire-hathaway-will-host-annual-meeting-in-person-11643138863?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein person\u003c/a\u003e on April 30. class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Waymo vehicle\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f42a921f45dacfac470f4e28337425b3638fc834-800x533.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eWaymo\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAutonomous car company Waymo is \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2022-01-28/waymo-robot-taxi-sues-state-secret-black-ice?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuing\u003c/a\u003e the California Department of Motor Vehicles over a request to share its fleet’s crash info with the public.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Alphabet subsidiary is also demanding that the DMV keep under wraps how it responds when its vehicles—which have just-in-case drivers—experience emergencies, veer off course, and navigate steep hills and tight curves (aka all of San Francisco, where Waymos are almost as common as soup dumplings).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWaymo’s reasoning?\u003c/strong\u003e These are “trade secrets” that would give its competitors, like GM’s Cruise, a leg up and releasing the intel would have a “chilling effect” on the entire industry because no one wants their proprietary tech put on blast.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOthers, including the DMV, argue that the public should know more about their autonomous neighbors, especially since Waymo’s developed a bit of a track record: With 24 crashes, it accounted for \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/self-driving-car-accidents-waymo-cruise-tesla-zoox-san-francisco-2022-1?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew#\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe most\u003c/a\u003e autonomous-mode crashes in CA last year out of its peers (though no serious injuries or fatalities), Insider reports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eexpect more regulatory tussles as autonomous vehicles slowly but surely make their way onto city streets. Waymo tripled the size of its CA fleet last year and started testing vehicles in New York and New Jersey.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS According to the General Social Survey, the share of people who said they were “very happy” plunged from 31% in 2018 to 19% in 2021, while the share of people who were “not too happy” surged from 13% to 24%. Over the past few decades, the very happy people had outnumbered the not-too-happies by about three to-one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote: \u003c/strong\u003e“Over the past two years, we prioritized certain strategic projects that distracted us from the laser-focus we needed to have on our core business: scaling our beauty brand.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEmily Weiss, founder and CEO of Glossier, told employees in a Wednesday email that the online beauty startup would be laying off over one-third of its corporate staff (about 80 employees). The brand that brought us “looking wet” as a makeup trend has grown to a valuation of more than $1 billion, but, “We also got ahead of ourselves on hiring,” Weiss wrote. “These missteps are on me.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRead: \u003c/strong\u003eSeven technologies to watch in 2022.
